description: Add tasteful class icons, species icons, and subtle background textures throughout the D&D character sheet app for a modern fantasy aesthetic

userStories.title: Set up icon directory structure and copy SVG files
userStories.description: As a developer, I need icon files organized in the public folder so they can be loaded by the app.
acceptanceCriteria: Create public/icons/classes/ directory
Create public/icons/species/ directory

Copy all 13 class SVGs from scratchpad to public/icons/classes/ with lowercase filenames (artificer.svg, barbarian.svg, bard.svg, cleric.svg, druid.svg, fighter.svg, monk.svg, paladin.svg, ranger.svg, rogue.svg, sorcerer.svg, warlock.svg, wizard.svg)

Copy available species SVGs to public/icons/species/ with lowercase-hyphenated filenames (tiefling.svg, forest-gnome.svg, high-elf.svg, drow.svg, firbolg.svg, triton.svg, yuan-ti.svg, air-genasi.svg, earth-genasi.svg, fire-genasi.svg, water-genasi.svg)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add dark mode CSS for icons
userStories.description: As a developer, I need CSS that inverts icon colors in dark mode.
acceptanceCriteria: Add .icon-invertible class to src/index.css
Class applies filter: invert(1) when .dark is present on parent
Add smooth transition for filter changes
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create ClassIcon component
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a reusable component to display class icons.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/components/ClassIcon.tsx
Component accepts className (string) and optional size (number, default 24) props
Component returns tag with src pointing to /icons/classes/{name}.svg
Component returns null for classes not in the available set
Uses icon-invertible class for dark mode support
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Available classes: artificer, barbarian, bard, cleric, druid, fighter, monk, paladin, ranger, rogue, sorcerer, warlock, wizard

userStories.title: Create SpeciesIcon component
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a reusable component to display species icons.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/components/SpeciesIcon.tsx
Component accepts species (string) and optional size (number, default 24) props
Component returns tag with src pointing to /icons/species/{name}.svg
Component returns null for species not in the available set
Converts species name to lowercase-hyphenated format (e.g., 'Forest Gnome' -> 'forest-gnome')
Uses icon-invertible class for dark mode support
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Available species: tiefling, forest-gnome, high-elf, drow, firbolg, triton, yuan-ti, air-genasi, earth-genasi, fire-genasi, water-genasi

userStories.title: Add icons to character sheet header
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see class and species icons in the character sheet header.
acceptanceCriteria: Import ClassIcon and SpeciesIcon components in CharacterSheetPage.tsx
Add ClassIcon next to class name in header (around line 1168)
Add SpeciesIcon next to species name in header (around line 1166)
Icons are 20-24px size
Wrap text and icon in inline-flex container with gap for alignment
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: icons appear next to class/species names

userStories.title: Add icons to home page character cards
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see class and species icons on character cards for quick identification.
acceptanceCriteria: Import ClassIcon and SpeciesIcon components in HomePage.tsx
Modify character card display (around line 131-133) to include icons
Class icon appears next to class name
Species icon appears next to species name (when available)
Icons are 18px size on cards
Layout remains clean and not cluttered
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: icons appear on character cards

userStories.title: Add icons to character creation page
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see class icons during character creation.
acceptanceCriteria: Import ClassIcon component in CharacterCreatePage.tsx
Show selected class icon prominently after class is chosen
Icon is 32px size
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: icon appears when class is selected

userStories.title: Add icons to spell picker modal
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see class icons in the spell picker to identify which classes can cast each spell.
acceptanceCriteria: In CharacterSheetPage.tsx spell picker section (around line 3535-3558), add class icons
Show small ClassIcon (16px) for each class in spell.classes array
Icons appear in the spell list rows near the spell name or in a dedicated area
Does not clutter the interface - icons are subtle
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser: class icons appear for each spell
